Neapolitan pizza

Pizza made with tomatoes and mozzarella cheese also known as Naples-style pizza.

Being Cheeeeesy..!

Calzone

An Italian oven-baked turnover made with folded pizza dough stuffed with salami, ham or vegetables, mozzarella, ricotta, and Parmesan or pecorino cheese.

Sicilian pizza

A thick crust pizza rectangular in shape topped with onions, anchovies, tomatoes, herbs, and strong cheese such as caciocavallo and toma. The sauce is sometimes placed on top of the toppings to prevent it from soaking into the thick dough.

Last updated 3 mins ago

Stromboli

A rolling-up filled with cheese and meats or vegetables, usually oven-baked. Similar to Calzone but doesn't contain tomato sauce filling.

"Ottavia"

The world's largest pizza was prepared in Rome in December 2012, and measured 1,261 square meters (13,570 square feet).

Chicago Style Pizza

A high edge pizza with large amount of cheese and tomato sauce with a thick crust.

New York Style Pizza

an Italian oven-baked turnover made with folded pizza dough stuffed with salami, ham or vegetables, mozzarella, ricotta and Parmesan or pecorino cheese.

Panzerotti

A turnover filled with tomatoes and mozzarella, usually fried rather than oven-baked.

Pizza Sleep nd Repeat..!!
